resources.string: An easy way to manage your items!
This project is open source and available at
Inventory Manager is a tool to help you manage your stuff. You can store anything you want!
Username to login to the server
Could not connect to the target server: %s
Click on a filter to add it to the query (typing also works) then add a \';\' at the end of the filter to validate it. Tip: use $name to search names with regex.
Selects movables with the same details
Selects all descriptions starting with a query
Selects all objects matching the state
Selects all items matching the Serial Number
Selects all items matching the Reference
Selects all objects matching the Name
Selects the object with that ID
We couldn\'t find any result to your query:
Sorry but we could not find any object with this ID:
We need your permission to access the camera to scan codes
Sorry, we couldn\'t find any scans in your recent activity
Created and designed by Sofiman with
The app will try automatically to connect one by one to the registered servers (favorite first)
Codes that cannot be found in the database will be added to the history as well
A Tracker is a device that updates the properties of all scanned objects, like object\'s locations or state.
Use this device as a tracker
The app is fully translated in multiple languages
You may restart the app to view to intro
Click on the ID to copy it or simply scan or share this QR Code!
To use scanned data, first focus on a field then click on the scanned data field
You are about to clear the scan history (%d items)
You can now use the locate feature
Inventory Manager is based around public and private servers. We offer a basic public server for users that want to use simply the app.
To join the Public Server you need an account that requires an username and password
Thank you for using my app! Thank you to all who supported and helped me through it development. If you want to help me more you can contact me via GitHub. (Public servers and Illustrations)

"All data used by the app is stored and managed by the target server. We recommend using only trusted servers. Servers can by default collect:
- The username, Used device name and IP Address - App Usage analytics - Scan History and scan text contents (scanned pictures are processed locally) Data that cannot be collected: - Geolocation of the device - Video streams from cameras - Les photos issues de scans"
